core.grammar
Interface Terminal

All Superinterfaces:
Element
All Known Implementing Classes:
TerminalImpl
public interface Terminal
extends Element

The inteface declares the methods that define the responsabilities of a Terminal object. It belongs to the Public API.

Author:
Jorge Couchet

Methods inherited from interface core.grammar.Element

Method Detail

getAllRightsProd

java.util.Collection<Production> getAllRightsProd(Grammar g)
Returns all the Productions where the Terminal is at the right side. If there aren´t Productions return NULL.

Parameters:
g - The Grammar associated to the Terminal.

getRightProd

Production getRightProd(Production p,
                        Grammar g)
Checks if the Terminal is at the right side of the Production with ID==p.getId(). If it is TRUE returns the Production, if not returns NULL.

Parameters:
g - The Grammar associated to the Terminal.
p - The Production object used as a filter. It is only necessary that has a value in the ID field.

setRelation

Production setRelation(Production p,
                       Grammar g)
                       throws GrammarExceptionImpl
If any Terminal symbol that belongs to the Production p match with the Terminal that is represented by THIS, then the method sets the right structure of the Terminal with the Production p. Otherwise the method don´t do anything. In the right structure is where the Terminal holds the reference to the Productions where participates. The method returns NULL if the ID of p doesn´t collide with other ID. If there is a collision, then the new p replace the old_p, and the method returns old_p. Throws a GrammarException if the Production is NULL or there was a problem.

Parameters:
g - The Grammar associated to the Terminal.
p - The Production object used as a filter. It is only necessary that has a value in the ID field.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

cloneTerminal

Terminal cloneTerminal()
                       throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Clone the Terminal, returning a new one.

Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

clearTerminal

void clearTerminal()
Clear the structures used by the Terminal Object.
